comments.body: Corn could be two blocks tall, and you'd get the seeds from double tallgrass.  It would take a long time for the corn to grow the first block, but after that it grows really quickly.  You can just chop of the second block and wait for it to grow back.  The second block would drop corn cobs, which could be crafted into corn seeds.

They could also add cornfields and new types of birds like crows and have to protect our crops with scarecrows.
and also to be able to roast our corn in the oven and thus recover more life or to be able to make popcorn with them
The seeds are normal at first and then the world becomes weird and some are high ground and some are short and the Minecraft is crashing
Who doesn't want to run through a corn field or create crops circles? ü§î
We need this
yes pls and they also need to add the popcorn in a bucket then cuz popcorn is one of the most important things in life
I wish I could paint a painting to

This update will completely change how paintings work in Minecraft. When players attempt to craft a painting it will craft a canvas instead. This canvas can be put on an easel where players can edit the size of the painting and use dye to change each individual pixel with a brush. The original paintings can only be found in chests, with some new paintings included as well. Paintings will also be able to be placed on the floor and the ceiling similar to an item frame.
Good idea. Also, I think it would be cool if the brush used is the same one used for suspicious sand and gravel. I've always liked when they use the same item for multiple things.

I adore this idea. To add my two cents, perhaps cauldrons and dyes could be used for ‚Äúcave drawings,‚Äù allowing players to mark up blocks. The brush introduced in the Trails and Tales update could also boast a secondary use due to this feature being implemented. My idea is a little rough around the edges, but ‚Äúcave markings‚Äù (like what Rust does with signs) would be very cool.
Sounds good, I say it for the skeletons that always shoot you
This could really add more to pvp and just gameplay in general!
I like the idea of shield enchantments since it would change how PVP works. Perhaps the pounce enchantment would redirect explosions.

It just makes sense

Add Unbreaking, Mending and Protection to Shields,

A new enchantement could be "reflect" (reflect arrows)

i like this idea, i would also say for it to have other already used enchantments as well such as  unbreaking, mending and maybe something like thorns so damage is reflected back if they hit your raised shield
I would love to put unbreakability or thorns on my shield!!

As of 8/31/2022 the shield already have Unbreaking and Mending.

IMO the Shield should be allowed to have Thorns and Protection (just like armor pieces) on the shield as well.
I love the Pounce enchantment, but I think it should be called "Deflecting".

I just logged on to the site to specifically search for something like this! A stone cutter equivalent for wood makes perfect sense. I would love to see this added.

I think it would be cool if a new structure such as a sawmill is added and the villager inside functions like a wandering trader, this could be added to a specific biome, such as the Birch Forrest or Jungle variants. The woodwork Bench would be his job site block. It also needs a very costy recipe as it is pretty easy to get wood in the game, you don't need any tools before you can punch a tree. Something like two stone one iron ingot and three wooden planks of any kind. Thats my idea!

I think the wood work should be thinking. I agreed! The concept of stone cutter and its ratio 1:1 justify its craft. The same it will happen with wood. I don't know how feasible it is due the balance, but if it was made to the stone, why not with the wood.

Applying the same logic, 1 wood to make a fence, we can think about it. I don't think it's to much. 

This block will be considered a profession block. So the carpenter have to be included in the package. It will sell wood things no surprises, with the normal prices and loot table. 

There is a lot of sense on that in a future of professions updates perhaps.
I was about to post the idea you've posted. I cannot agree with you more.

Hammers should have similar aspects as the debug stick but using with fences, stairs, walls and doors that can be obtained in the survival world. Or you could add sledgehammers and framing hammers into minecraft
Being able to change a block into one that is affected by gravity would be a great new funtionality for a tool.
Add in an inherent knockback effect? Perhaps it ignores 5%/tier of armor below crafted material of Hammer. Can be used to create Wood pulp or Mulch (could be used in place of bone meal?).
Noice, maybe we could create crystal panes with it too. Or if used with some diamond, we could have hardened crystal pane, more blast resistant than normal glass pane.

someting cool that could work is colored ligting.

if you combine glowstone with a colored crystal you will get colored glowstone.

Cool idea, i think that crystal should be used for some way of enchanting. With minecraft, there is only one route when it comes to armour: Get diamond, enchant, upgrade to tools. I think crystals could make non-enchantable armour through the smithing table. For example: A diamond chestplate infused with red crystals could do the same as thorns, and blue crystals maybe could make you dash. This is just my idea and i think it would make minecraft more interesting.
It makes me sad that only 6 people have voted do far. i want this so bad
Maybe make torches not be able to melt it so we could use it for igloos?
I think that repeated attacks with a fishing line would work for this, even though it requires skill.  I have actually yanked fish out of a river with one for quick fishing.

You should be able to craft a lingering potion onto a net to give the net a potion effect. Say you need to move a mob through the Nether, use a fire resistance net. Say you need to kill your target, poison net.
Or you could have the potion drain by one level for each use, applying only the base level of that effect, with a time delay between consecutive uses so you don't just instantly drain the cauldron.
I meant that if something or someone is standing in thencauldron, it gives the effect for free as long as they were standing in the cauldron.
Maybe combine both ideas and use sneak to "drink" a dose (1/3 cauldron), while just standing in it will give the effect while there and not drain the cauldron at all.
Mobs should avoid filled cauldrons for this reason. I get very annoyed when my cats stay in cauldrons where I can't reach them.
I'd also love to see a potted variant
I personally think this is a great idea

Minecraft has a lot of blocks, but what if they had more? Why do we need them? Please don't just add lists of things - these will be marked as spam and removed! Also, no furniture, guns, or vertical/"sideways"/"upright"/"standing" slabs (yes, we see you).
